title.narrative: Readiness Support to Strengthen PNG's Engagement with the GCF

description.narrative:
PNG is highly vulnerable to the impacts of climate change. Although its absolute emissions level is very low, the NDC for PNG is to achieve 100.00% renewable energy by 2030. Thus, the country has an increasing need for climate financing to address its adaptation and mitigation obligations, but there has been no attempt in accessing climate finance yet. PNG has to address the challenges through its mandated government organization, the Climate Change Development Authority (CCDA). It is therefore important to build the capacity of CCDA in its role as the National Designated Authority (NDA) to the GCF and its processes to support stakeholders in PNG to access climate finance.
Against this backdrop, the project aims to support the readiness to green climate financing for PNG through strengthening the country's engagement with the GCF.

The project will support the readiness to green climate financing for PNG through strengthening the country’s engagement with the GCF with three key outcomes, including 1) Strengthening country capacity; 2) Consultative stakeholder engagement; and 3) Private sector mobilization.

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04551 Republic of Korea

title.narrative: GCF Outcome 2: Stakeholders engaged in consultative process

description.narrative: Number of participants in consultation meeting

title.narrative: Deliverable 2.1.1 Policy and stakeholder analysis reports
Deliverable 2.1.2 GCF training package developed for the 4 regions of PNG.
Deliverable 2.1.3 Workshop reports from 4 trainings
Deliverable 2.1.4 Provincial Climate Change Committees trained with GCF training packages, supporting Committee engagement in subnational planning
Deliverable 2.2.1 Country Programme for PNG developed
Deliverable 2.2.2 Workshop proceedings reports for inter-ministerial workshops for PNG's Country Programme
Deliverable 2.2.3 PNG's Country Programme is validated by the National Adaptation and Mitigation Technical Working Groups and endorsed by the management of CCDA (minutes of validation workshop)
Deliverable 2.3.1 Guidelines on integrating gender perspectives and participation on climate change in PNG
Deliverable 2.3.2 Workshop proceedings and above guidelines to consider input from the workshops
Deliverable 2.4.1 Mechanism for participatory review established and initial GCF portfolio assessed.
GCF Outcome 5: Private sector mobilization

description.narrative: Training evaluation form from capacity building activities

title.narrative: Deliverable 5.1.1 Feasibility study report on private sector mobilisation

Deliverable 5.2.1 Forum report with recommendations for engaging the private sector in climate change consultative processes in PNG, plans for implementing potential private sector investments, and recommendations for establishing a private sector advisory committee to the CCDA Board.
GCF Outcome 1: Country capacity strengthened
Deliverable 1.1.1 NDA capacity strengthened. Operating manual and two workshop reports
Deliverable 1.1.2 Published materials (preinted and online), distributed and shared
Deliverable 1.2.1 Final draft NOL procedure developed.

Deliverable 1.2.2 NOL procedure finalized and endorsed by the Management of the CCDA with clear recommendations from the National Adaptation & Mitigation Technical Working Groups in fully consultative manner and workshop report.
Deliverable 1.3.1 GCF and PNG P&I Agreement approved and ratified.
Deliverable 1.4.1 Capacity of NDA and other stakeholders on climate finance monitoring, oversight, and streamlining improved and workshop report.
Increased mobilization of climate finance in PNG.
Amount of climate finance mobilized
PNG’s capacity to engage with the GCF to mobilise climate finance is strengthened.

description.narrative: level of finance PNG mobilizes from GCF
